data.description: <p>There are 7 billion people on this planet. And by 2050, there will be 2 billion more... many moving into urban centers at an unprecedented rate. Making sure there is enough food, fiber and infrastructure for our rapidly growing world is what we’re all about at John Deere. And it’s why we’re investing in our people and our technology like never before in our 175-year history. Here the world’s brightest minds are tackling the world’s biggest challenges. If you believe one person can make the world a better place, we’ll put you to work. RIGHT NOW.</p><p> </p><p>Title: Data Antalytics Intern<br>Primary Location: US<br>Organizational Group: Data and Analytics</p><div><div style='padding: 10px 0px;border: 1px solid transparent;'><div style='font-size:16px;word-wrap: break-word;'><H2 style='font-size: 1em; margin: 0px'></H2>&#13;</div><div><p style="margin-bottom: 3px; margin-top: 6px;"><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;">The<strong> Data &amp; Analytics Intern program</strong> will provide an opportunity to apply your data science and data engineering skills to solve business problems within a specific department and functional area. Opportunities exist across varied functional areas such as Financial Services, IT, Precision Agriculture, Customer &amp; Product Support, Supply Management, Sales &amp; Marketing, Order Fulfillment &amp; Engineering.</span></p><p style="margin-bottom: 3px; margin-top: 6px;"> </p><p style="margin-bottom: 3px; margin-top: 6px;"><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: #000000;">What will you do? </span></strong></span></p><ul><li style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;"><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><span style="font-style: normal;"><span style="tab-stops: list .5in;">Lead and/or support key analytics projects</span></span></span></li><li style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;"><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><span style="font-style: normal;"><span style="tab-stops: list .5in;">Manage and work with large, diverse data sets </span></span></span></li><li style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;"><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><span style="font-style: normal;"><span style="tab-stops: list .5in;">Learn and apply appropriate data science and data engineering techniques to solve business problems</span></span></span></li><li style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;"><span style="font-style: normal;"><span style="tab-stops: list .5in;">Collaborate with data and analytics colleagues as well as key business stakeholders</span></span></span></li></ul><p style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;"> </p><p> </p><p><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><span style="font-style: normal;"><span style="tab-stops: list .5in;"><span style="color: rgb(226, 8, 8);"><strong>Work Statement:</strong> US Visa sponsorship is not available for this position.</span></span></span></span></p><p> </p></div></div><div style='padding: 10px 0px;border: 1px solid transparent;'><div style='font-size:18px;word-wrap: break-word;'><H2 style='font-size: 1em; margin: 0px'><b>Requirements</b></H2>&#13;</div><div><ul type="disc"><li style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;">Pursuing a Bachelor’s, Master’s, or PhD Degree in Data Science, Analytics, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering or related quantitative discipline</span></li><li style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;">Desired cumulative GPA of 2.8 on a 4.0 scale</span></li><li style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;">Knowledge of applied statistical analysis, modeling techniques, and data visualization methods</span></li><li style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;">Ability to demonstrate your development of algorithms and predictive models to solve a problem</span></li><li style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;">Proficiency in programming languages SQL, R, Python </span></li><li style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;">Must pass a Data &amp; Analytics HackerRank Assessment</span></li></ul><p> </p><p> </p><p><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;"><strong>Must be able to relocate domestically</strong>. Assignments can be at various locations throughout the United States, including Quad Cities area (Moline or Davenport), Des Moines area and Chicago. </span></p><p> </p><p> </p></div></div></div><p><strong>What You'll Get</strong></p><p>At John Deere, you are empowered to create a career that will take you to where you want to go while working in an inclusive team environment. Here, you'll enjoy the freedom to explore new projects, the support to think outside the box and the advanced tools and technology that foster innovation and achievement. Interns receive competitive compensation and are eligible for many of the benefits offered to full-time employees, including:</p><p> </p><ul><li>Flexible work arrangements</li><li>Highly competitive base pay </li><li>Savings &amp; retirement benefits (401k and Defined Benefit Pension)</li><li>Healthcare benefits </li><li>Employee Assistance Programs</li><li>Tuition assistance</li><li>Fitness subsidies and on-site gyms at specific Deere locations</li><li>Charitable contribution match</li><li>Employee Purchase Plan &amp; numerous discount programs for personal use</li><li>Sponsored housing for onsite internships</li></ul><p> </p><p>The information contained herein is not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities and qualifications required of individuals performing the job. The qualifications detailed in this job description are not considered the minimum requirements necessary to perform the job, but rather as guidelines.</p><p> </p><p>John Deere is an equal opportunity employer, including disabled &amp; veterans.</p><p> </p><p>Monthly Salary based on published rates based on business function and education level is $4600-$7100. </p>
